title: Viral video appears to show Trump saying 'smart people don't like me'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump appeared to speak at a Hope Through Education gala according to a video posted online. 'Smart people don't like me,' he said.

title: Who is TikTok's American buyer? Trump says US will announce soon
shortDescription: President Donald Trump told reporters on Tuesday, Sept. 16 that TikTok will keep running in the U.S. and a buyer of the app will be announced soon.

title: Trump, Epstein photo displayed in UK
shortDescription: A giant photo of President Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein was put on display outside of UK's Windsor Castle ahead of Trump's state visit.

title: Georgia DA Fani Willis can't prosecute Trump after appeal rejected
shortDescription: The Supreme Court of Georgia rejected an appeal from Fulton County DA Fani Willis over being disqualified from prosecuting President Donald Trump.

title: Trump sues New York Times for $15 billion
shortDescription: Donald Trump files $15 billion lawsuit against the New York Times and four of its reporters for defamation claims.

title: Trump sues The New York Times for defamation and libel, seeks $15 billion
shortDescription: Trump threatened last week to sue the New York Times for its reporting on an allegedly sexually suggestive note and drawing given to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Patel testifies to Congress about Charlie Kirk investigation
shortDescription: Meanwhile, FBI Director Kash Patel is testifying to Congress over the highly scrutinized investigation into Charlie Kirk's killing.

title: Trump ends longtime DC peace vigil, sparking First Amendment questions
shortDescription: The White House described the tent as a "hazard," but the demonstration's volunteers characterized Trump's actions as a First Amendment violation.

title: Democrats, Trump at odds over funding as shutdown nears
shortDescription: As Congress braces for another government shutdown, Democrats and Republicans are still at odds.

title: GOP vigil at Capitol honors Charlie Kirk
shortDescription: GOP leaders gathered at the U.S. Capitol for a vigil honoring Charlie Kirk, emphasizing his values and denouncing politically motivated violence.

title: In loss for Trump, appeals court lets Lisa Cook stay at Fed for now
shortDescription: The appeals court ruling does not settle the key issue of whether President Trump can remove Lisa Cook for what he considers just cause.

title: Trump sends Guard to Memphis
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is launching the Memphis Safe Task Force to fight violent crime using the National Guard.

title: Speaker Mike Johnson holds vigil for slain activist Charlie Kirk
shortDescription: The 31-year-old Kirk was killed on September 10 when hit by a single bullet in his neck while addressing a large crowd at Utah Valley University in the town of Orem.

title: Vance hosts Kirk’s show from White House
shortDescription: Vice President JD Vance hosted “The Charlie Kirk Show” from the White House, honoring his late friend and featuring guests like Tucker Carlson.

title: Trump says he ordered second strike in Caribbean
shortDescription: President Donald Trump confirmed a second U.S. military strike on alleged Venezuelan drug traffickers.

title: Trump deploys National Guard to Memphis with governor's approval
shortDescription: Trump has deployed the National Guard in Los Angeles and Washington, D.C., earlier this year amid strong criticism from Democratic lawmakers.

title: How online reactions to Kirk's killing test limits of First Amendment
shortDescription: Comments online are leading to firings as conservative lawmakers and influencers look to curb speech seen as negative to Kirk.

title: Trump says 3 killed in second strike on alleged drug traffickers
shortDescription: Trump said he ordered the strike, and that no U.S. forces were harmed. Those targeted were "transporting illegal narcotics," he said.

title: When is the next TikTok ban deadline? Trump teases deal days before
shortDescription: President Donald Trump's administration is saying they have reached a framework deal to spinoff TikTok from its parent company. When is the deadline?

title: Trump attacks left-wing 'agitators' and 'scum' after Kirk shooting
shortDescription: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday (September 14) he would attend the funeral of conservative activist Charlie Kirk in Arizona.

title: Trump plans crackdown on liberal groups after Charlie Kirk shooting
shortDescription: After the Charlie Kirk assassination, the Trump administration is planning to use "every resource" to target left-wing groups they say are violent.

title: Watch live: Trump to sign presidential memorandum at White House
shortDescription: The president is scheduled to sign a presidential memorandum on Monday, Sept. 15, though the White House has not clarified what the document addresses.
